info.name: Mage Hunter
info.description: Mage Hunter (Fighter subclass) from LP Mills' Sealight
info.author: Sealight

description.p: While magic is common in Sealight, it is not universal. To your average citizen, few things are more frightening than a maniac wielding a fireball, or a necromancer defiling graves and communing with the departed. This is where the Monterosso Mage Hunter’s Guild comes in: hailing from Blackrock, the Mage Hunters are a collective of wandering mercenaries who specialize in locating and neutralizing rogue spellcasters. Viewing spellcasters as cowardly and unnatural, Mage Hunters memorize simple defensive spells that allow them to close in on their targets, disabling any active magic before plunging their weapons into the magician’s squishy, craven heart.

td.em: Mage Hunter Spellcasting, Tricks of the Trade

description.p: When you reach 3rd level, you augment your mage hunting with the ability to cast defensive spells.

element.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher

description.p: You know two 1st-level wizard spells of your choice. These spells must be from the abjuration school of magic. The Spells Known column of the Mage Hunter Spellcasting table shows when you learn more wizard spells of 1st level or higher. Each of these spells must be an abjuration spell of your choice, and must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level. The spells you learn at 8th, 14th, and 20th level can come from either the abjuration, evocation, or transmutation schools of magic. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the wizard spells you know with another spell of your choice from the wizard spell list. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots, and it must be an abjuration spell, unless you're replacing the spell you gained at 3rd, 8th, 14th, or 20th level from the evocation or transmutation schools.

Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your wizard spells, since you learn your spells through study and memorization. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a wizard spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier

When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you learn how to recognize signs of spellcasting. You have advantage on Survival checks to track foes capable of innate spellcasting or possessing one spell slot or more, as well as on Investigation checks to identify any arcane focuses, spellbooks, or phylacteries they may possess. Additionally, you learn one exotic language, such as Abyssal, Celestial, or Deep Speech.

You have advantage on Survival checks to track foes capable of innate spellcasting or possessing one spell slot or more, as well as on Investigation checks to identify any arcane focuses, spellbooks, or phylacteries they may possess.
You may cast the Monterosso’s Mirror cantrip as a bonus action.
A slow Mage Hunter is a dead Mage Hunter. At 7th level, you gain the ability to cast the Monterosso’s Mirror cantrip as a bonus action.
You have advantage on seeing through the effects of illusion magic, and cannot be charmed, blinded or deafened by magical means.
At level 10, you are able to bypass your target’s trickery. You have advantage on seeing through the effects of illusion magic, and cannot be charmed, blinded or deafened by magical means.
You can cast counterspell at 3rd level without expending a spell slot a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier.
At level 15, you learn the secrets of intercepting your foe’s magic. You can now cast counterspell at 3rd level without expending a spell slot a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier.

You can cast dispel magic at 3rd level without expending a spell slot a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier. When you score a critical hit on a ranged or melee weapon attack, you may burn one of your target’s spell slots. This spell slot must be 3rd level or lower.

By level 18, you have little patience for your spell-flinging quarry. You can now cast dispel magic at 3rd level without expending a spell slot a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier. Additionally, when you score a critical hit on a ranged or melee weapon attack, you may burn one of your target’s spell slots. This spell slot must be 3rd level or lower.
